text: Vadim Viktorovich Bakatin (; 6 November 1937 - 31 July 2022) was a Russian politician. He was the last chairman of the KGB in 1991.Yevgenia Albats and Catherine A. Fitzpatrick. The State Within a State: The KGB and Its Hold on Russia--Past, Present, and Future. 1994. due to political reasons.J. Michael Waller. Russia: Death and Resurrection of the KGB. He was the Minister of Interior of the Soviet Union before, from 1988 to 1990. He ran for President of Russia in the 1991 election. Bakatin was born in Kiselyovsk, Kemerovo Oblast, Soviet Union. Bakatin died on 31 July 2022 at a hospital in Moscow, Russia at the age of 84.В Москве умер последний председатель КГБ СССР Вадим Бакатин ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Directors of Soviet intelligence agencies Category:KGB people Category:Russian politicians Category:Kemerovo Oblast
